ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class provides a strong foundation about the why and how behind common, molecular biology techniques. A great foundation to help researchers troubleshoot and design better experiments.
I learned about synthetic biology and basic laboratory techniques like PCR, running gels, and transforming bacteria with custom DNA constructs via a Gibson assembly.
Laboratory skills such as PCR, gels, etc

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The actual in class time was good, but the homework was kind of all over the place. The experiments and lecture were interesting, but the homework was either really easy (psets) or took an inordinate amount of time (final paper and presentation). I would also appreciate clearer guidelines and more feedback throughout the semester.

Strengths  the assignment load was great and very manageable and the class was well run. Professor Nelson is great and I always had a good time in class. 

Weaknesses  it would be helpful if students could get more feedback on their work rather than just point deductions without any reasoning as to why we lost points.
Loved this course! Although early and more clear feedback would be appreciated

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this course was an excellent biology lab and I'd recommend it to any student interested in training their wet lab skills and learning more about pioneering research done in molecular/cell biology today.

This course is much better than what I have heard about other MCDB lab courses, and overall was an interesting overview of molecular biology. Although the course is aimed at juniors and seniors, I think it is better designed for earlier researchers. Additionally, the course was easy but grading was quite obscure.
Yes  if you have to take a biology lab requirement for MCDB, take this class. Its the best lab course in MCDB at Yale by far.
Yes, one of my favorite MCDB classes at Yale!

extras.title: MCDB 343L 01 - Laboratory in Nucleic Acids II
